hero.heading: Fiberglass
hero.copy: Fiberglass doors are durable, low maintenance and can even look like wood or steel.

inspiration.heading: It’s durable.
copy: Do you live in a particularly hot, cold, wet or dry climate? Fiberglass is designed to withstand both ends of the weather spectrum without warping or rotting. And it won’t dent, either.

small.alt: Pella IM Fiberglass Patio Door COB

inspiration.heading: It’s low maintenance.
copy: Because of its baked-on protective finish, you won’t need to refinish or repaint it as it ages. It’s also easy to clean.

small.alt: Jeld-Wen Painted Smooth Fiberglass Swinging Patio Doors

inspiration.heading: It’s versatile in style.
copy: Right down to the knots, cracks and colors, fiberglass can be made to look like real wood. Smooth white and paintable finishes also make it a dent-resistant steel alternative. Your guests will be none the wiser.

small.alt: Jeld-Wen Stained Oak Fiberglass Swinging Patio Doors

next.heading: Next, let’s discuss the benefits of vinyl.
next.copy: Vinyl is a low-maintenance material formulated to look great for years to come.
